chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. Boyles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Disarming a Peace Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.21.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

miscConds.notes: Defendant has 216 days credit if probation revoked.
Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Absolute Sobriety of controlled substances or alcohol.  Random UAs and BAs.complete all programming by agent.  Take all prescriptions as prescribed by doctor.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael A. Boyles in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Michael A. Boyles in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim notification met.  State makes recommendations and history of DE and case.  3 years probation; conditions as PSI recommends; 6 mos. SCJ.  216 days jail credit if probation revoked.  Atty. Middleton makes recommendation and history of DE.  2 years probation, treatment, no jail time.   Court dismisses Cts. 1-4 but reads in.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 5:

3 years Probation
55 days SCJ, w/work release, Forthwith  
216 days credit if probation revoked
Provide DNA sample
Undergo any counseling per agent
Complete all programming by agent
Absolute Sobriety of controlled substances and alcohol
Submit to UA and BA testing
Not consumption any controlled substances or alcohol 
Full time employment/schooling or combo of both
Take all prescriptions as prescribed by doctor
AODA & treatment
$518.00 C/C  & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant Michael A Boyles in court with attorney Peter Middleton.  Defendant Michael Boyles in custody.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court states case.  Attorneys state appearances.  Atty Middleton makes statement regarding bond modification.  State objects.  Atty Middleton responds.  Court finds basis for conditions are still appropriate.  Court denies motion to modify and bond continues as originally ordered.

Defendant Michael A. Boyles in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Michael A. Boyles in custody.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No contest plea entered on Count 5, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court dismisses but reads in Cts. 1-4.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court orders PSI and set out sentencing.  Report to be prepared and to the court no later than Aug. 7, 2015
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Atty Middleton acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties and enters Not Guilty pleas - Set for Trial.  Bond continued.

Defendant Michael A. Boyles in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Michael A. Boyles in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Middleton states DE will waive prelim today.  DE is in agreement.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.

Pre-trial conference on February 20, 2015 at 10:15 am.
Return date on March 12, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Michael A. Boyles in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Michael A. Boyles in custody.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Middleton gives status.  Waiver of time limits today, requesting PTC/Rd. Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 10:15 am.  Return date scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on February 6, 2015 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Michael A. Boyles by video from LEC with attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day.  Defendant Michael A. Boyles in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State requests cash bond.  Atty Meyer-O'Day responds.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $3,000.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times from drugs and alcohol, no taverns/liquor stores, no contact w/J.B. or J.K., not to go to Kuester's Bar and no contact w/Deputy Scott Steinhorst or his family.  Atty Meyer-O'Day states DE will qualify for PD appt.  Court sets prelim as DE had to be removed from hearing and couldn't be there to waive his time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 10:15 am.
